```{r}
library(readr)
library(here)
library(dplyr)
library(recodeflow)

my_variables <- read.csv(here("worksheets", "variables.csv"))
my_variable_details <- read.csv(here("worksheets", "variable-details.csv"))

source(here("R", "medications.R"), local = knitr::knit_global())
source(here("R", "diabetes.R"), local = knitr::knit_global())
source(here("R", "kidney.R"), local = knitr::knit_global())
source(here("R", "blood-pressure.R"), local = knitr::knit_global())
```

# Replicate rows for each clinicid to match the number of columns in cycle1

  clinicid = rep(clinicids, each = num_vars_cycle1),
  clc_age = rep(c(20, 30, 40, 50), each = num_vars_cycle1),
  clc_sex = rep(c(1, 2, 1, 2), each = num_vars_cycle1),

2. Recode medication variables for individual cycles.
```{r}
# Recoding basic variables from cycles 1 and 3
cycle1_prescription_data <- rec_with_table(cycle1, c("clinicid", "atc_101a", "mhr_101b"), variable_details = my_variable_details)
head(cycle1_prescription_data)

cycle3_prescription_data <- rec_with_table(cycle3, c("clinicid", "meucatc", "npi_25b"), variable_details = my_variable_details)
head(cycle3_prescription_data)

# Recoding derived variable acemed for cycle1. Select vars by role used to avoid writing all med variables in one line
cycle1_ace_prescription_data <- rec_with_table(cycle1, c("clinicid", recodeflow:::select_vars_by_role("Drugs", my_variables)), variable_details = my_variable_details)
head(select(cycle1_ace_prescription_data, clinicid, acemed)) 

# Recoding derived variable acemed for cycle3. Much simpler function used here.
cycle3_ace_prescription_data <- rec_with_table(cycle3, c("clinicid", "meucatc", "npi_25b", "acemed"), variable_details = my_variable_details)
head(cycle3_ace_prescription_data)
```

3. Merge recoded medication data
```{r}
# Aggregating recoded cycle3 data by clinicid
cycle3_ace_prescription_data <- cycle3_ace_prescription_data %>%
  group_by(clinicid) %>%
  summarize(
    meucatc = paste(unique(meucatc), collapse = ", "),  # Concatenate unique values of meucatc
    npi_25b = paste(unique(npi_25b), collapse = ", "),  # Concatenate unique values of npi_25b
    acemed = max(as.numeric(as.character(acemed))) # Find maximum of acemed
  )
head(cycle3_ace_prescription_data)

# De-factorizing acemed variable in recoded cycle1 data
cycle1_ace_prescription_data$acemed <- as.numeric(as.character(cycle1_ace_prescription_data$acemed))

# Merging recoded cycle1 and cycle3 data, and ensuring one acemed column in the end
cycles1and3_ace_prescription_data <- merge(cycle1_ace_prescription_data, cycle3_ace_prescription_data, by = "clinicid")
head(cycles1and3_ace_prescription_data)

cycles1and3_ace_prescription_data <- cycles1and3_ace_prescription_data %>%
  mutate(acemed = pmax(acemed.x, acemed.y)) %>%
  select(-c(acemed.x, acemed.y))
head(cycles1and3_ace_prescription_data)
```

4. Determine hypertension status by recoding medications 
```{r}
# Recode medication variables first - anymed for hypertension and diab_drug for diabetes which is involved in determining HTN
cycle1_htn_prescription_data <- rec_with_table(cycle1, c("clinicid", recodeflow:::select_vars_by_role("Drugs", my_variables)), variable_details = my_variable_details)
head(cycle1_htn_prescription_data)

# Create/copy dummy medication variable from recoded medication variable
cycle1_htn_prescription_data$anymed2 <- as.numeric(as.character(cycle1_htn_prescription_data$anymed))
cycle1_htn_prescription_data$diab_drug2 <- as.numeric(as.character(cycle1_htn_prescription_data$diab_drug))
cycle1_htn_prescription_data <- select(cycle1_htn_prescription_data, clinicid, anymed2, diab_drug2)

# Merge medication data with original data
cycle1 <- merge(cycle1, cycle1_htn_prescription_data, by = "clinicid")
head(cycle1)

# Recode hypertension (and diabetes) status using recoded, dummy medication variables
cycle1_htn_data <- rec_with_table(cycle1, c(recodeflow:::select_vars_by_role("Test", my_variables)), variable_details = my_variable_details)
head(cycle1_htn_data)

# For cycles 3-6, flatten the recoded medication data (see section #3), merge that flattened data with original data, and then create dummy variables before recoding hypertension (and diabtetes) status 
```
